Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Fetal Striatal Transplantation in Huntington's Disease

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 17 patients with mild HD from the NEST-UK cohort were included.

Participants.evidence: 17 patients with mild HD from the NEST-UK cohort were included.

Intervention.evidence: Five patients were randomly selected for bilateral fetal striatal transplantation, while 12 served as controls.

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the safety and efficacy of fetal striatal transplantation in HD.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in the Unified Huntington's Disease Rating Scale (UHDRS) motor score over 10 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: The study was open-label, with no blinding of patients or clinicians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between 2000 and 2003, five patients received transplants.

Number_Analysed.evidence: No significant differences were observed in UHDRS scores between the transplant and control groups over 10 years.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean difference in UHDRS motor score was not significant (p > 0.05).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included transient renal function decline and anaemia, resolving after immunosuppression cessation.

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by the NEST-UK consortium.
